page.title: 04EDUCATION - Further Info
page.content:
The rural catchment area consists of the villages of Cotherstone, Romaldkirk and Lartington, with the hamlet of Hunderthwaite and Baldersdale, which is an area of scattered farms. 74% of the children travel to school by transpot which is provided by the Durham Local Education Authority. Mid-day meals are cooked at the school at a charge of 60p daily. The school kitchen also provides 14 meals for the elderly, twice weekly, which are delivered by the Women's Voluntary Service.
At the age of 11 years most pupils transfer to Teesdale Comprehensive School which is 6 miles away in Barnard Castle, but usually 1 or 2 boys transfer to Barnard Castle school, which is a Boy's Public School.
